title: Puerto Rico's New Governor Faces Legal Challenge
summary: Senate leader says Pierluisi lacks support in chamber, turns to territory's Supreme Court. Puerto Rico's newly installed Gov. Pedro Pierluisi faces a critical test in court, as he struggles to consolidate power and resolve a leadership crisis that has paralyzed the U.S. territory's government.

title: Trade War Becomes Currency War
summary: Exchange-rate shifts introduce a new risk to global growth.. President Trump claims trade wars are easy to win, but that boast looks worse than ever amid the financial carnage from his latest threat of tariffs on Chinese goods. His trade war has now become a currency war, which raises the potential economic harm to another level.

title: Politics and the Shooters
summary: The Dayton killer was a left-winger, but don't blame Sen. Warren.. Police in Dayton say they're still seeking a motive for Connor Betts' shooting spree that killed nine people, including his sister. But whatever turns up, we hope no one blames Elizabeth Warren.

title: The Very Political Fed
summary: The central bank looks to dominate the real-time payments market.. Federal Reserve officials want to protect their independence from politics, but then why do they keep trying to control more of the private economy like politicians? Consider the Board of Governor's self-justifying decision Monday to big foot private banks with a competing public real-time payment system.

title: Play Starring Jake Gyllenhaal Has Strong Broadway Showing
summary: Set to open this week, 'Sea Wall/A Life' grossed $732,000 in past week. Hollywood favorite Jake Gyllenhaal is proving to be a draw on Broadway as well.

title: Victoria's Secret Parent's Longtime Marketing Chief to Resign
summary: He exits as the brand's overtly sexy marketing strategy had drawn consumer backlash. L Brands Inc. said Edward Razek, its longtime chief marketing officer, will step down from his role, as the parent company of Victoria's Secret faces backlash from consumers about the unit's marketing strategy.

title: When Biden Was Tough on Crime
summary: In 1994, violence had reached a frightening peak. No one knew it was the start of a long decline.. 'There are people right now in prison for life for drug offenses," Sen. Cory Booker told Joe Biden at last week's debate, "because you stood up and used that 'tough on crime' phony rhetoric that got a lot of people elected but destroyed communities like mine. This isn't about the past, sir. This is about the present right now."

title: 'The Intelligence Trap' Review: How Smart Is Too Smart?
summary: IQ scores have never been so high and access to factual information so widespread. Yet all our cleverness rarely helps us overcome our biases.. Every year brings more books about how stupid we are. Apparently humans are impulsive, gullible and prone to making all sorts of bad decisions. We are also fascinated by our shortcomings, if the shelves at airport bookstores are anything to go by. The latest contribution to the pile is from David Robson, a London-based science journalist, who offers an intriguing angle on our flawed habits of mind. In "The Intelligence Trap," he argues not only that we are walking, talking, error-making machines, but also that the cleverest among us may make the biggest mistakes.

title: If You Want 'Renewable Energy,' Get Ready to Dig
summary: Building one wind turbine requires 900 tons of steel, 2,500 tons of concrete and 45 tons of plastic.. Democrats dream of powering society entirely with wind and solar farms combined with massive batteries. Realizing this dream would require the biggest expansion in mining the world has seen and would produce huge quantities of waste.

title: America Needs an Independent Fed
summary: The economy functions best when the central bank is free of short-term political pressures.. This article is signed by Paul Volcker, Alan Greenspan, Ben Bernanke and Janet Yellen.

title: All John Bolton's Wars
summary: What do the Iranian regime, the New York Times and Sen. Rand Paul have in common?. "I believe Mr. Trump does not seek war. But Mr. Bolton and Netanyahu have always sought war." Thus spoke Iran's foreign minister, Javad Zarif, at a Monday press conference in Tehran. It's not the first time Mr. Zarif has tried to drive a wedge between President Trump and his national security adviser, John Bolton-or between the president and his most steadfast international ally, Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu. But for Mr. Bolton, Mr. Zarif implies, we could have peace in the Middle East tomorrow.

title: American Decline? We've Been Here Before
summary: The U.S. was in rough shape in the late '60s. Prudent statecraft brought it back.. After two decades of relentless setbacks abroad, it's time to ask whether the decline in American influence is irreversible.

title: GateHouse Media Parent to Buy Gannett for $1.4 Billion
summary: Deal combines largest owner of U.S. newspapers by titles and the largest newspaper group by circulation. The country's two largest newspaper chains agreed to combine their businesses in a roughly $1.4 billion deal, further consolidating an industry reeling from strong economic headwinds.

title: Toddlers Don't Have to Go to School
summary: Parents are resisting the pressure to enroll their kids earlier.. On the best-seller wall of my local bookstore is Mo Willems's new picture book, "The Pigeon HAS to Go to School!" My children adore Mr. Willems's books, but he's got one thing wrong: The pigeon doesn't have to go to school.

title: 'Bias Teams' Welcome the Class of 1984
summary: A chilling look inside colleges' systems for reporting and policing offensive speech.. Hundreds of American colleges have "bias-response teams" or similar mechanism for students or faculty to report bias incidents. These systems enforce political correctness and turn campuses into miniature surveillance states.

title: Dayton Shooter Used AR-15 Pistol, Smaller Version of Popular Rifle
summary: This appears to be first time the gun has been used in a mass shooting, according to law enforcement. The gunman who killed nine and wounded at least 27 in Dayton, Ohio, used an AR-15 style pistol in his attack, according to police, a smaller variation on the popular gun that has been used in many of the deadliest mass shootings.

title: Trump Condemns Racism, White Supremacy as Death Toll From Mass Shootings Rises
summary: President makes strongest comments about white supremacy to date; offers no major gun-control proposals. WASHINGTON-President Trump sharply condemned white supremacy and pledged a new focus on disrupting online mass-shooter plots, but he didn't unveil major gun-control proposals, in his first formal remarks to the nation since back-to-back massacres over the weekend.

title: China's Yuan Breaches 7-to-the-Dollar Level, Prompting Trump Critique
summary: Beijing suggests the currency's weakening came in response to President Trump's latest move to broaden tariffs on Chinese goods. China's currency broke through the psychologically important level of 7 yuan to the dollar, prompting President Trump to accuse Beijing of manipulating its currency in a way that would backfire.

title: Barneys Nears Bankruptcy Filing With Plans to Close Most Stores
summary: Retailer in talks with lenders to keep open seven stores, secure financing that would give it time to find a buyer. summary: Yield on U.S.'s benchmark 10-year Treasury notes touches lowest intraday level since October 2016. ​Government bond yields plumbed multiyear lows around the world and an important market-based recession indicator flashed new warning signals Monday, spurred by investors' worries that intensifying trade tensions will drag on the economy.

title: Fed to Create Payments System to Speed Money Transfers
summary: Move will provide a public option to another real-time network built by big banks. WASHINGTON-The Federal Reserve plans to develop a faster payments system for banks to exchange money, providing a public option to another real-time network built by big banks.

summary: The exchange's technology-overhaul project, called Pillar, has faced difficulties in prior rollouts. A troubled technology overhaul at the New York Stock Exchange is about to face its biggest challenge yet.

title: Trump and Warren and Violence
summary: Maybe politicians should stop blaming opponents for the actions of third parties.. "2020 Democrats lay blame on Trump's rhetoric for shootings," reports the Associated Press. Will some 2020 Democrats also end up blaming themselves as more evidence is collected about the shooters in El Paso and Dayton? Strange as it may seem for people not in the business of politics or punditry, it's popular in these fields to blame ideological rivals for the violent acts of third parties.

title: Mail Bomber Cesar Sayoc Sentenced to 20 Years in Prison
summary: Trump supporter had pleaded guilty to 65 felonies for mailing bombs to prominent Democrats across U.S.. The Florida man convicted of mailing pipe bombs to prominent Democrats across the U.S., in what federal prosecutors called a widespread terrorism campaign, was sentenced Monday to 20 years in prison.

summary: Concerns grow that tussle could disrupt coming probes into big tech companies. WASHINGTON-The Justice Department and the Federal Trade Commission are clashing over their oversight of the Trump administration's antitrust agenda in the technology industry.

title: Isolation, Social Media Combine to Radicalize Violent Offenders
summary: Social media is increasingly playing a role, especially among lone actors like the ones responsible for El Paso and Dayton shootings. Recent mass-violence incidents in America share common threads: disaffected individuals who feel powerless, radical ideas that blame particular groups and the use of social-media platforms that bring these factors together and amplify them.

summary: Dow, S&P, Nasdaq slide; Trump accuses China of engaging in currency manipulation.. Waves of selling battered stock indexes from New York to Shanghai on Monday as fresh trade threats between Beijing and Washington raised fears of an economic slowdown.

summary: Government's move, which covers more than 24,000 children, clears up a problem of statelessness. summary: The boundary-breaking singer-songwriter avoids social media, weaves R&B with other kinds of music and has become a sensation despite flouting music-industry conventions. title: India Ends Kashmir's Special Status
summary: Decision sparks political uproar and risks unrest in area in dispute with nuclear rival Pakistan. summary: China is highly unlikely to have to burn through hundreds of billions of dollars of reserves to fight speculators. The weakening of the currency signals the opening of another front in the trade war, and brings with it big risks for investors.

title: Farm-Income Pinch Filters Through U.S. Economy

title: Trump Confronts Violence-and a Bitter National Divide
summary: President condemns racism, bigotry and white supremacy after mass shootings, but critics want action on gun control. The opportunity was to use the moment to start changing the dangerously angry tenor of the national conversation.

title: California Education Language Is Newspeak
summary: Who understands "the study of intersectional and ancestral roots, coloniality, hegemony, and a dignified world where many worlds fit"?. Regarding Williamson M. Evers "California Wants to Teach Your Kids That Capitalism Is Racist" (op-ed, July 30): I couldn't get past the second paragraph without laughing out loud. Who understands "interdisciplinary study of race, ethnicity, and indigeneity with an emphasis on experiences of people of color in the United States" or "the study of intersectional and ancestral roots, coloniality, hegemony, and a dignified world where many worlds fit" or "xdisciplinary [sic], loving, and critical praxis of holistic humanity." My auto-correct would hardly let me write this. Who talks like this? If my kids wanted to major in this kind of garbage, they would have to get their own student loans. I would have no part of it. California has lost its mind.

title: In Praise of the Much-Maligned Nation State
summary: Younger Americans have been fed a steady diet of antination-state dogma in public schools and universities. As the world's most powerful and abusive nation-state, the U.S. is identified as Planet Enemy No. 1.. Regarding Christopher DeMuth's "America's Nationalist Awakening" (op-ed, July 20): Why has such an old idea suddenly become new again? Because "the federal government has abdicated basic responsibilities and broken trust with large numbers of citizens."

summary: There may be many in "non-Western" countries who want to come here because they already believe in our values.. title: An Outside Hedge Fund Is Driving Steve Cohen's Gains
summary: As the hedge-fund billionaire's returns have dropped, he's bet big on ex-employee Gabe Plotkin. Billionaire Steven A. Cohen's hedge fund is up about 10% this year. But a significant part of that return has come from a money manager who doesn't work at Mr. Cohen's fund.

title: Finger-Toe Shoes: Strange, Yet Beloved By Many
summary: From designer label Margiela's tabi boots to Vibram's popular FiveFinger athletic shoes, articulated toe shoes remain popular, despite their peculiar aesthetic. TABI SOCKS, designed to separate the big toe from the other four, first appeared on male samurai warriors in 15th-century Japan, to be worn with or without sandals. The original intent is a question mark. Were tabi socks for improving balance? For maxing out toe strength? For grounding the wearer to the earth? Regardless, the tabi concept resurfaced a while back in the fashion world, where it has simmered at a low boil for years, trickling up from socks into sneakers and boots. Fashion eccentrics are not alone in embracing the articulated toe-look: Sensible, athletic types love Vibram's toe-separated sneakers.

title: Gun Control Is Thrust Into 2020 Campaign, but Laws Face Hurdles
summary: Democrats criticize Trump's rhetoric, call for legislation they say would curb mass shootings. summary: Resume Subscription. We are delighted that you'd like to resume your subscription.

title: HSBC CEO John Flint Is Out After 18 Months in Role
summary: Noel Quinn, bank's global commercial banking head, to serve as interim chief. HSBC Holdings PLC said late Sunday that Chief Executive John Flint is out and new leadership is needed to meet the bank's challenges.

title: El Paso Murder Spree Renews Spotlight on 8chan Online Forum
summary: Patrick Crusius allegedly posted on the same message board as New Zealand mosque suspect. The man suspected of killing 20 people and injuring 26 more in a shooting rampage at a Walmart in El Paso, Texas, allegedly posted a hate-filled manifesto on the same fringe online message board used earlier this year by the suspect in the Christchurch, New Zealand, mosque massacre.

title: More Mutual-Fund Disclosure? Beware of TMI
summary: A George Mason professor says more mutual-fund disclosure may be a case of too much information. Often investors assume that more is better when it comes to disclosure of the portfolios and trading activity of the mutual funds they hold. Transparency, they believe, can only help them in making investment decisions that can maximize their personal returns.

title: What, Investors Worry? Yes, but U.S.-Stock Funds Are Up 19%
summary: Wariness resurfaces as Fed signals lack of enthusiasm for continued cuts. Mutual-fund investors are sleeping well, based on their average gains for the year so far. But they're sleeping with one eye open.

title: As Emerging Markets Recover, Here's What Investors Need to Know
summary: For one thing, be aware that ETF flows can affect pricing. Emerging markets are bouncing back-but before fund investors plunge in, there are some things they should know.

title: Why Aren't Investors Worried? Ask Howard Marks
summary: Oaktree Capital's co-founder says the duration of the recovery and inflation are causes for concern. Howard Marks, co-founder of Oaktree Capital Management, is known for his investing prowess and his prescient, easy-to-read market commentaries.

title: Stocks and Bonds Are Up at the Same Time. It May Not Be Such a Bad Omen.
summary: Conventional wisdom says this is a bearish sign for equities. History says otherwise.. Much ink has been spilled recently about how unusual it is that both stocks and bonds have performed so well this year-and how it's a bad omen for equities when they do.

title: Money Is Pouring In to Low-Volatility Funds
summary: Investors keep waiting for a stock-market downturn. Low-volatility funds are proving popular as many cautious investors keep preparing for a still-unseen, but long-anticipated, market downturn.

title: Some Closed-End Funds Seem to Have Permanent Premiums
summary: They trade above their net asset value for months or more. What does that mean for investors?. Among the stock market's many anomalies is the persistent premium over net asset value-20% to 80% or more in many cases-that often exists for a small number of closed-end mutual funds. For example, (GUT) has had an NAV floating around $5 a share for the past year but has been trading between $6 and $7.

title: REITs Show Resilience
summary: Concerns about the economy ease as REITs fortify themselves and focus on holdings that can provide stability. After a sluggish end to 2018, real-estate investment trusts are showing promise again.

title: ETFs Don't Rule Gold, After All, Says One Analysis
summary: In a survey, professional investors say they use the futures market more often for their gold trades. The launch of exchange-traded funds backed by gold bullion changed the way investors could access the precious-metals market.

title: About to Retire? Check Your Stock Exposure-Quickly
summary: We ran a simulation showing how various portfolio allocations performed for someone who had retired in 2000-and it was revealing. There are a lot of people thinking of retiring now because the bull market has boosted their 401(k)s.

title: What Does 'Premium-Priced Bonds' Mean?
summary: Yields have come down so much that there are many bonds trading at higher than face value. Investors may increasingly find bond-market strategists referring to "premium-priced bonds." Individuals would do well to understand the terminology because it may help them make better investments.

title: Quran-Guided Funds Attract Non-Muslims
summary: Funds avoid sectors including tobacco, alcohol, gambling, weaponry and pornography. Amana Mutual Funds Trust builds products designed to appeal to Muslim investors, but the company says its funds have won a much broader following.

title: Vegans May Soon Have an ETF
summary: The ETF will seek to avoid companies whose activities directly contribute to animal suffering or environmental destruction. Some analysts are skeptical.. Investors who identify as passionate vegans and environmentalists may soon have an exchange-traded fund that invests according to those principles.

title: Money Rains on a Cloud ETF
summary: Global X Cloud Computing ETF, launched in April, has more than $500 million in assets under management. A new exchange-traded fund focused on cloud computing is off to a strong start with an investment strategy that differs from an established rival's.
categories: Spotlight: Global X Cloud Computing ETF
